message.entry: The classNames must be unique.
The classNames must be one of the following types: cell array of char vectors, string array, or a categorical array.
The input to segmentObjects must be a grayscale or RGB image, or a batch of images, or a datastore returning images.
The feature layer must produce an array with only one non-singleton dimension.
The input size must be 1x3 vector. The first two elements should be multiples of 32 and the third element should be equal to 3.
The classification network must be a dlnetwork.
The classification network must be a dlnetwork with a fully-connected layer.
The input network must have a fully-connected, global average pooling, or convolutional layer that produces an array with only one non-singleton dimension.
The NormalizationStatistics structure must contain the following fields: Mean and StandardDeviation.
The 'Mean' and 'StandardDeviation' field values of the NormalizationStatistics structure must be a vector of size [1 {0}].
Running Reidentification network
* Processed {0} images.
Finished processing images.
The trainingData must be a valid datastore.
The trainingData imageDatastore must have labels.
The trainingData must have a label for every image file.
The ground truth labels in the trainingData input must have the same categories as the ClassNames on the reidentificationNetwork object.
Supported GPU not found. Update the 'ExecutionEnvironment' on trainingOptions to 'cpu'. Or, to automatically determine if a GPU is available, use 'auto'.
Invalid reidentification network. The network must be an object of type reidentificationNetwork. Please use the reidentificationNetwork() function to create the network.
The input labels must not be empty.
The input labels must be a string array, a cell array of character vectors, or a categorical array.
Ranks must not have any repeating values.
Rank must be one or more numerical values from 1 to the total number of classes or specified as 'all'.
There must be at least two instances of every object to evaluate reidentification metrics.
RGB triplets of type 'single' or 'double' must be specified with values in the range [0,1].
LineColor value must not be hexadecimal.
The number of colors specified must be scalar or match the number of classes in the reidentificationMetrics object.
LineColor must be a scalar string/char array or a 1-by-3 RGB triplet for plotType 'cmc' and 'precision-recall'.
Configuring reidentification metrics
* Setting all query images.
* Building gallery sets.
Calculating {0} metric
* Calculating {0} metric for class {1}.
* Aggregating and finalizing the metrics.
